title: How to Soak Your Toes for a Pedicure

steps.title: Fill a plastic tub with warm water.
steps.content: Fill a plastic tub with warm water. Make sure it is warm, for cold or hot water will not help make it more enjoyable or relaxing.

steps.title: After that, add Epsom salt to the water.
steps.content: After that, add Epsom salt to the water. If you would like a more relaxing, spa-like pedicure experience, you can also add in your favorite scented oil. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Now, place your feet in the water and soak for at least ten whole minutes.
steps.content: Now, place your feet in the water and soak for at least ten whole minutes. Try using a timer. Soaking your feet as long as possible will help you remove the dead skin easily later. [2] X Research source

steps.title: After soaking, remove one foot (right or left, your preference) from the water and leave the other to soak.
steps.content: After soaking, remove one foot (right or left, your preference) from the water and leave the other to soak.

steps.title: Rub a pumice stone on the bottom of your foot (the one taken out from the water), concentrating on the roughest areas.
steps.content: Rub a pumice stone on the bottom of your foot (the one taken out from the water), concentrating on the roughest areas. Foot files also work well for removing dead skin. Try both to see what works best for you. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Place the foot you just scrubbed back into the water and repeat the previous step on the opposite foot.
steps.content: Place the foot you just scrubbed back into the water and repeat the previous step on the opposite foot.

steps.title: Remove your feet from the water and gently pat them dry.
steps.content: Remove your feet from the water and gently pat them dry.
